title: E. Jean Carroll seeks ‘very substantial’ new damages after Trump called her a ‘whack job’ in CNN town hall
description: Writer E. Jean Carroll on Monday asked a judge to update her still pending original defamation lawsuit against former President Donald Trump to add a new claim after he trashed her as a "whack job" during his CNN town hall earlier this month.

title: Sen. Tim Scott vows not to overturn the election if he loses
description: Sen. Tim Scott, who officially launched his 2024 presidential bid on Monday, sat down for an exclusive interview with NBC News.

title: Fake picture of explosion at Pentagon spooks Twitter
description: A fake image purporting to show an explosion near the Pentagon briefly went viral on Twitter on Monday, leaving fact-checkers to scramble to counter the false claim as it was pushed by a variety of verified accounts.

title: U.S. still risks breaching debt limit on June 1, Treasury Secretary warns in new letter
description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said it is "highly likely" the U.S. will hit the debt ceiling as early as June 1, reiterating the deadline to resolve the crisis.

title: 2 boys found dead in NYC waterways remembered as devoted students who dreamed of success
description: Alfa Barrie, 11, and Garrett Warren, 13, are remembered for their ambition in school and ease in connecting with others.

title: TikTok files lawsuit against Montana over download ban
description: TikTok filed a lawsuit against Montana on Monday over a new law aimed at stopping people from downloading the app, arguing the ban violates the First Amendment.

title: Tribal member fatally shot by Border Patrol agents in Arizona; FBI investigating
description: The FBI and Tohono O’odham Nation police are investigating the fatal shooting of a tribal member by U.S.

title: Ron DeSantis is learning that not every state wants to be Florida
description: As Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis pushes his "Make America Florida" agenda, states start to (politely) push back.

title: Suspect accused of murdering Idaho college students stands silent during not guilty plea
description: MOSCOW, Idaho — Bryan Kohberger, the suspect accused of fatally stabbing four Idaho college students, stood silent in court on Monday as a judge entered not guilty pleas on all murder charges.

title: Marine veteran seen on video putting Jordan Neely in chokehold: 'I’m not a white supremacist'
description: Daniel Penny, the marine seen on video putting Jordan Neely in a chokehold, said he is not a white supremacist.

title: Sen. Tim Scott jumps into the 2024 presidential race
description: Sen. Tim Scott, the lone Black Republican in the Senate, announced he is running for the 2024 GOP nomination for president.

title: Biden and McCarthy to meet as debt ceiling deadline looms days away
description: President Joe Biden is scheduled to meet with Speaker Kevin McCarthy on Monday afternoon to discuss a path forward to avert a debt ceiling crisis.

title: 60,000 pounds of an explosive chemical is lost during rail shipment, officials say
description: About 60,000 pounds of a chemical used as both a fertilizer and an explosive is missing after likely disappearing during a rail trip from Wyoming to California last month, according to federal records.

title: Using 'he/him' and 'she/her' in emails got 2 people fired at small Christian college
description: Shua Wilmot and Raegan Zelaya, two former dorm directors at a small Christian university in western New York, acknowledge their names are unconventional, which explains why they attached gender identities to their work email signatures.

title: 7 killed and 4 injured in Oregon highway crash were farmworkers, union says
description: The victims of one of Oregon’s deadliest highway crashes were farmworkers traveling in a van at an hour when agricultural laborers typically commute home after toiling in the harvest, the state’s farmworkers union and Mexican officials said.

title: Ukraine signals the battle for Bakhmut is far from over after Russia claims victory
description: Russia may have effectively captured the symbolic prize of Bakhmut, but Ukraine signaled Monday that it hopes to ensure the battle was far from over by encircling Wagner troops there.

title: Meta hit with record $1.3 billion fine over E.U. user data transfers to the U.S.
description: Meta has been fined a record 1.2 billion euro ($1.3 billion) by European privacy regulators over the transfer of European Union user data to the U.S.

title: 'It gets real': GOP presidential primary sprawls beyond a Trump-DeSantis clash
description: As Sen. Tim Scott and Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis enter the GOP presidential race this week, at least 6 other Republicans are signaling their interest in running.

title: China tells tech manufacturers to stop using Micron chips, stepping up feud with the U.S.
description: China’s government on Sunday urged owners of computer equipment deemed sensitive to cease purchasing goods from Micron Technology Inc., the largest U.S. memory chipmaker, in an effort to escalate its dispute with Washington over technology and security.

title: 2 missing NYC boys found dead; medical examiner says one accidentally drowned
description: New York City police on Sunday continued to investigate the deaths of two boys last seen walking together in Harlem but found lifeless in waterways on opposite sides of Manhattan.

title: 8-year-old sought help 3 times on day she died, immigration officials say
description: HARLINGEN, Texas — An 8-year-old girl who died last week in Border Patrol custody was seen at least three times by medical personnel on the day of her death — complaining of vomiting, a stomachache and later suffering what appeared to be a seizure — before she was taken to a hospital, U.S. immigration officials said Sunday.
